title: 112_s884
content: The Act titled "Domestic Energy Promotion Act of 2011" establishes a variable VEETC rate based on the price of crude oil. The Excise Tax Credit under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include specific rates for calendar years 2012 and 2013, as well as for calendar quarters after 2013. "If the average price of crude oil changes, the applicable rate for the Excise Tax Credit will be adjusted." The tax credit rate for crude oil varies based on price ranges, with the rate decreasing as the price per barrel increases. The average price of crude oil for a calendar quarter is determined by the average 3-month futures price on the New York Mercantile Exchange for light sweet crude oil. The tax credit rate for crude oil is adjusted based on price ranges, decreasing as the price per barrel increases. Amendments have been made to extend tax credits and payments until 2016, with changes to the income tax credit table in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The tax credit rate for crude oil is adjusted based on price ranges, decreasing as the price per barrel increases. Amendments have been made to extend tax credits and payments until 2016, with changes to the income tax credit table in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. For calendar year 2012, the applicable rates are 20 cents and 14.8 cents, for 2013 it is 15 cents and 11.1 cents, and for any calendar quarter after 2013 but before 2017, the 1st and 2nd applicable rates apply. The tax credit rate for crude oil varies based on the average price per barrel in the preceding calendar quarter. The rates range from 30 cents to 4.44 cents, decreasing as the price per barrel increases. Tax credit rates for crude oil range from 6 cents to 4.44 cents for prices between $80 and $90 per barrel, and drop to 0 cents for prices above $90 per barrel. The tax credit for crude oil prices is based on the average 3-month futures price on the New York Mercantile Exchange for light sweet crude oil. Amendments extend the tax credit until 2016 and repeal certain sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The effective date for these changes is after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3 extends the cellulosic biofuel producer credit through 2016 by amending the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. SEC. 4 extends and modifies the alternative fuel vehicle refueling property credit. Extension for Ethanol Refueling Property under section 30C of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include fuel described in subsection (c)(2)(A)(ii) after December 31, 2016. Certain ethanol blends are eligible for the credit, with at least 85 percent volume consisting of natural gas, compressed natural gas, or liquefied. The amendment includes a credit for dual-use refueling property in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, allowing for a blend of ethanol and other specified fuels, with certain volume requirements. The amendment in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 introduces a credit for dual-use refueling property, where 100 percent of the cost can be treated as qualified alternative fuel refueling property if certain conditions are met. If the property is not used as required within 5 years, recapture of the cost is applicable. The amendment introduces a credit for dual-use refueling property, defined as property that is both qualified alternative fuel vehicle refueling property and used for storing or dispensing fuels not described in subsection (c)(2) or for purposes other than delivering fuel into a motor vehicle's fuel tank. Effective date for the amendments is after December 31, 2011. SEC. 5. Extension of special depreciation allowance for cellulosic biofuel plant property to January 1, 2017. SEC. 6. Staged reduction of ethanol tariff. Heading 9901.00.50 of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States was amended for Calendar Year 2012, reducing the rate of duty from 14.27 cents to 5.28 cents effective January 1, 2012. For Calendar Years 2013 through 2016, the rate was further reduced to 3.96 cents. The rate of duty was reduced from 14.27 cents to 5.28 cents on January 1, 2012. Amendments to change the date from "Before 1/1/2013" to "Before 1/1/2017" will take effect on January 1, 2013.
